dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 2880 IH: Martin Luther King, Jr. National Historical Park Act of 2015
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Lewis (for himself, Ms. Moore, Mr. Hastings, Ms. Clarke of New York, Ms. Hahn, Mr. Higgins, Mr. Grijalva, Ms. Lee, Mr. Van Hollen, Mr. Nadler, Mr. Levin, Mr. Israel, Mr. Meeks, Mr. Bishop of Georgia, Mr. Cummings, Mr. Johnson of Georgia, Ms. Brown of Florida, Mr. Cohen, Ms. Wilson of Florida, Mr. Rangel, Ms. Fudge, Ms. Jackson Lee, and Mr. Serrano) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To redesignate the Martin Luther King, Junior, National Historic Site in the State of Georgia, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Martin Luther King, Jr. National Historical Park Act of 2015.

section.header: Martin Luther King, Jr. National Historical Park
section.text: The Act entitled An Act to establish the Martin Luther King, Junior, National Historic Site in the State of Georgia, and for other purposes (Public Law 96–428) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a) of the first section, by striking the map entitled Martin Luther King, Junior, National Historic Site, numbered 489/80,013B, and dated September 1992 and inserting the map entitled Martin Luther King, Jr. National Historical Park Proposed Boundary Revision, numbered 489/128,786 and dated June 2015;
by striking Martin Luther King, Junior, National Historic Site each place it appears and inserting Martin Luther King, Jr. National Historical Park;
by striking national historic site each place it appears and inserting national historical park; and
by striking historic site each place it appears and inserting historical park.

section.text: Any reference in a law (other than this Act), map, regulation, document, paper, or other record of the United States to Martin Luther King, Junior, National Historic Site shall be deemed to be a reference to Martin Luther King, Jr. National Historical Park.
